item.title: MongoDB Compute Autoscaling Overview
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. This is an Enterprise-only feature. Please install KubeDB Enterprise Edition to try this feature. MongoDB Compute Resource Autoscaling This guide will give an overview on how KubeDB Autoscaler operator autoscales the database compute resources i.e. cpu and memory using mongodbautoscaler crd. Before You Begin You should be familiar with the following KubeDB concepts: MongoDB MongoDBAutoscaler MongoDBOpsRequest How Compute Autoscaling Works The following diagram shows how KubeDB Autoscaler operator autoscales the resources of MongoDB database components.

item.title: MongoDB Replicaset Autoscaling
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. This is an Enterprise-only feature. Please install KubeDB Enterprise Edition to try this feature. Autoscaling the Compute Resource of a MongoDB Replicaset Database This guide will show you how to use KubeDB to autoscale compute resources i.e. cpu and memory of a MongoDB replicaset database. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.
